name: Grand Hyatt New York

reviews.text: We found a great deal for this hotel using TravelZoo. Centrally located, next door to Grand Central Station, 2 blocks from 5th Ave. The Check-in was all done electronically, which was easy to follow, but it would have been nice to actually speak to someone! The concierge was extremely helpful every time we went to his desk area. Everyone working at the hotel were friendly, helpful and always smiling! They seem genuinely happy to see us! The elevators were separated into the first 23 floors and then 24-34, so we were express to the 24th floor, which meant no milk run elevator rides. We were on the 33rd floor ( near the top!) and had a fantastic view of the Chrysler Building! Our room was comfortable with a very good chair for work at the desk ( lumbar support!). Flat screen TV too. The beds could have been a bit cushier, but there were lots of pillows and extra blankets if we wanted them. I had a couple occasions to speak to housekeeping and to the front desk. Both times my questions were answered in a friendly way, and anything we required was seen to immediately.
reviews.title: Great Location, Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was no fan in the bathroom, but it wasn't a big deal. We had a window in our room that opened! :)
reviews.title: Not Grand. Expensive for price. Excellent Location.

reviews.text: There are vending machines and ice on every floor and every morning there were newspapers available on each floor.
reviews.title: Walls as thin as paper

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a shuttle service to the Newark Airport only one block away from the hotel-- 15$ to the airport. We loved staying here and will do so again and again!
reviews.title: Great Hotel & Location

reviews.text: I stayed here at the end of January in one of the Lexington Suites. I was able to check in at midday which were very accomodating. The front desk was polite and friendly and were able to give me a room with an excellent night view of the Crysler Building on the 29th Floor.
reviews.title: Unbeatable location where subway stations are next to you!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a five night break at the Grand Hyatt. As the previous reviewer commented, the location is perfect, away from the manic bustle of Times Square but still within walking distance. We had a king deluxe room, only slightly more expensive than the basic package. The room (2736) was very spacious and spotlessly clean although the bathrooms in the hotel could probably do with an upgrade and there was no view. However, this did mean that the room was very quiet and we had no trouble with our neighbours. We have high standards and were pleasantly surprised with the hotel, expecially after reading some of the previous reviews. New York is very expensive as the exchange rate is dreadful but all things considered, we can't wait to return! A couple of tips - take the Staten Island ferry to see the Statue of Liberty as it is free and book any Broadway shows with the Box Office at the venue.
reviews.title: Stay Here!

reviews.text: We just got back from a week in New York City and I couldn't wait to write a review about our stay there! First of all, we were extremely impressed with the city overall, from the airport (JFK) to the subways, to every little part of the city. It is a very clean and friendly city!! It was our first time there, we brought our two teenage children, and we all had a GREAT time! It was Easter week and toward the latter part of the week the city got crowded, especially Times Square, but still we were able to avoid the crowds for the most part. Which brings me to my review of the Grand Hyatt. Being as how we'd never been to NYC before, I thought that mYbe being closer to Times Square was the way to go, but NO! We found that the location of the Hyatt was absolutely perfect!!!!! It is next to Grand Central Station (which means that it is convenient to get to ANYWHERE in the city by taking the subway) but it is far enough from the ridiculous crowds in Times Square (which feels like Vegas)! We were always so happy to get back to our hotel at the end of each day. The lobby is BEAUTIFUL, the staff are really wonderful, and our room was great. The day we got there, the front desk attendant, Gordon, wrote out explicit directions for us to get a quick little self-guided tour of the city, from our hotel. It was such a great walk around in order to see some of the famous sites around, like Times Square, Rockefeller Center and Radio City Music Hall. As soon as I saw Times Square, I was SOOOO happy that I didn't book a hotel in that area. Our hotel was convenient to everything you would want to see, with the added bonus of being like a respite from the chaos of the city. We loved it and can't wait to go back! We would definitely stay there again!!
reviews.title: Perfect location! Excellent service! Friendly staff! Just Beautiful!!

reviews.text: Great hotel, nice rooms and perfect location! Highly rec!
reviews.title: Wow

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check-in was great, and we were upgraded to the club level. The room was spacious by NYC standards and was clean. The linens were really nice and the bed comfortable. The bar was nice, though pricey, and was open late. Our only complaint was that someone in the room next to us left room service items in the hallway, and they were not cleaned up for several hours.
reviews.title: Great NYC Hotel!

reviews.text: first visit to NYC and got a good deal on the Grand Hyatt. Being in the center of NYC and on Manhattan, it was perfect for us. Just perfect. And everybody were friendly, serviceminded and helpful. I would strongly recommend this hotel to everybody that asks. Only thing, (why only 4 stars on rooms) is that the room is rather small - of course you dont spend a lot of time in the room but it fitted the 2 double beds and a desk and that was it. But again, wonderful hotel.
reviews.title: Location, location, location

reviews.text: I stayed at the Hyatt on business during February. The rooms are a reasonable size, but a bit spartan, but perfectly adequate providing you are not expecting luxury. There are a couple of negatives :the bath is so shallow that it is virtually impossible to immerse more than half of your body and no mini-bar. The latter point irritated me at first, but Hyatt to provide vending machine on each floor with drinks available at normal prices and a Starbucks in reception. This certainly keeps costs down, and Starbucks coffee is much better than the coffee you normally get in the room. The main plus point is location, next to Grand Central Station, and close to the shops. Reception is quick and efficient at all times. So yes, I may stay here again, and it is worth considering unless a long soak in the bath is an essential part of your stay.
reviews.title: It grows on you

reviews.text: I rolled the dice and won big time when my bid got accepted on Priceline for the Grand Hyatt. I entered $120 for a 4-star hotel near Times Square, and was pleasantly surprised that I was saving approximately half off!
reviews.title: The only hotel I'd stay at in NYC

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I did not have a single problem during my stay here ... from the time I called ahead to request that two beds be in the room (and wasn't charged extra, unlike many NYC hotels) to being able to check in hours early without even having to ask first.
reviews.title: Great Location in a Great City

reviews.text: The best amenity about the Grand Hyatt is its location in Grand Central Station. An earlier review was indeed accurate: Visitors can indeed go into the station without stepping a foot outside. This was incredibly convenient for my trips in Junior's!
reviews.title: Super Hotel, Great price, Close to transportation!
Official Trip to New York
reviews.text: The Grand Central location makes it easy to figure out which subway stop to get off at. Also be sure to take the airport buses that are across the street ... carrying luggage on the subway is uncomfortable and taking a taxi is too expensive. Bus tickets cost $12 for LGA and $15 for JFK.

reviews.title: Great hotel in the ideal location
reviews.text: The Hyatt is located on E 42nd St, right next door to Grand Central Station - you really don't have a chance to get wet in the rain when arriving by train. The rooms and lobby have all been recently renovated with a very modern yet functional theme. Web check-in was a breeze and the room was available 4 hrs early (1/2 hr ahead of my request on the train). Hotel is 8 blocks from 30 Rock & Radio City Music Hall, St Patrick's, Empire State Bldg, and theater district. 2 blocks from the Chrysler Bldg & just a few blocks west of the UN. It's located right next to the Lexington Ave line (4, 5, 6 trains) making access to Uptown & Downtown (City Hall, WTC, 9-11 Memorial, Greenwich Village, Statue of Liberty, Ellis Island) accessible within 15 min of leaving your hotel. We left our room at 11:45, did the express checkout at the "no brainier" kiosk, walked next door to Grand Central, bought our Metro North tix (yes, there was a line), found our departing track and boarded the 12:07 to New Haven with 7 min to spare - no joke. A great experience in a VERY convenient location.

Despite being in NYC quite often for work I have yet to find a decent hotel close to my office in Midtown so keep being drawn back to the Hyatt due to its location. That's about the only good thing about it to be honest. Rooms are small and dark, and as others have said bathrooms are tiny. I had no hot water for the 3 days I was there. When I called up to complain the disinterested lady on the other end suggested I tried turning the dial the other way! No one ever got back to me to explain why the situation had not been resolved. At every opportunity they attempt to take more money off you, charging for internet access, drinking water, bag storage etc. It leaves you feeling very ripped off.
reviews.title: Great location very average hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've read a number of the reviews on this hotel both before we went and once we'd returned and I'm surprised at some of the less than positive comments as our experience was absolutely delightful.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: The staff were ever friendly and helpful regardless of the time of day (or night). Never did I feel like I was intruding on them. Similarly, the consierge was incredibly helpful and arranged all sorts of things for us including a great birthday surprise for my girlfriend.
reviews.title: Impersonal and Big

reviews.text: The room was very clean and incredibly comfortable. We had one of the bigger rooms, but I will agree the bathroom was a little squashed in, especially the position of the toilet. A minor niggle as you don't really spend all your trip in the bathroom. One thing to note, which seems to be a recurring theme, is the lack of any in room tea/coffee making facilities which I think was on purpose to make visitors use the 24 hour market in the lobby. Sometimes though, a trip to the lobby for a cup of tea in the middle of the night is not something you want to do.
reviews.title: Good hotel, but not great

reviews.text: JUst fine really, but very expensive the few days we were there, although Yvone at the desk managed to get us a lower rate for our 2 and 3rd nights. Yet at those prices, wifi is extra? why? Also shower took a very long time to heat up, and had to step into shower to turn on water.. so got a blast of very cold water. but lovely soap. WHen i read other reviews they said to tip to get good service. but frankly i didnt see anyone to tip. took own bags up and down
reviews.title: grand hyatt new york
Happy Campers
reviews.text: Nice tv, but husband couldnt believe they didnt have HD channels. Excellent location. and little food store in lobby is open all the time.

We had a 5 night stay at the Hyatt Grand Central and had a good stay. We arrived late on October 2 with no luggage as Virgin Australia lost our bags. Immediately our check in assistant offered us emergency toiletries and directed us to a Duane Reade store a few doors down to buy brushes etc. She also took us to the porters to report that we were expecting the bags so they could keep an eye out for them when they arrived ( they never did, Virgin Australia is a disgrace, pitiful service ).
reviews.title: Terrible Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room for two adults and 1 fourteen year old was good. We upgraded to Regency Club level so were on the 33 rd floor over looking 42nd St. Room size is not huge but it is fine, we had two double beds which were very comfortable. The bathrooms are small but adequate alhough the toilet is jammed between the sink and shower. I am quite solid and it was ok but if your were a truly big man it would be uncomfortable. Water was hot and shower pressure was fine.
reviews.title: Excellent Location Great Hotel

reviews.text: Housekeeping were awesome especially considering the mess due to our lost bags and us having to buy clothes as we went.
reviews.title: Amazing place to stay, the service is amazing - especially Katie, Katushia and Jillian

reviews.text: I've stayed here twice in the last few months. The first time, we were given a lovely modern room- and were pleased with the fitness room and snack bar downstairs offering breakfast or late night treats. The second stay, I was told the King room I reserved was not available and "upgraded" to a noisy room across from the elevators. When I complained, I was given a key to a room that was already occupied surprising two of us. When the manager was alerted I was finally shown to the original King room I had requested. I will say the management did seem to care about the sketchy service and made things right.
reviews.title: Great location-but inconsistent

reviews.text: I stayed at the Grand Hyatt in early October 2012. I was on a business trip and highly dependent on my computer to operate in the hotel. When I tried to get connected it would not work; I was connected by the hotel operator to a service in Guatamala City - and was on the phone with a young man for 2 1/2 hours while he tried different things to make it work - explaining in the course of it that the servers in the hotel had a weak signal in some rooms and maybe I should change my room. I finally gave up and went to bed; the next morning I was able to connect by disabling virus protection - a very unsatisfactory resolution that he never even suggested.
reviews.title: A problem for business travellers

reviews.text: Aside from that the room was clean and pleasant - but without good computer service, it is a real problem for a business traveler. I rate the service and facilities as excellent except for this problem - but this problem was really important to me and it left a bad taste in my mouth.
reviews.title: Perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were able to check in early on Columbus Day long weekend and were upgraded without asking. Room was surprisingly spacious. Not much view but the only time spent there was to sleep. Staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Location was ideal, close proximity to Times Square and all of the attractions. We had dinner one evening in the restaurant and found the food to be very good and reasonably priced. Would definitely return for our next trip to New York.
reviews.title: Rooms are renovated but DIRTY

reviews.text: Very disappointed with my stay. Bathroom tub was chipped (looked like it had been reporcelainized poorly before), hair all over the bathroom and hotel room, etc. DISGUSTING. Other things that were annoying was their high-tech lighting control which did not make sense. Some buttons said to turn on "night lights" and many lights came on, other buttons on the switch by the bed said "all lights on/off" and if someone was in the bathroom it turned the bathroom lights off on them - there was no way just to turn off the lights in the room. Also, dust bunnies throughout the room with hair (easily seen by the chair in the room which appears hasn't been moved for cleaning), TV reception was very granular - even on their hotel information channel so it wasn't the cable coming into the hotel, the digital clock in the room wasn't set to the correct time (off by over 8 hours) and there wasn't an obvious way to set it ourselves.
reviews.title: Great base for shopping in NYC

reviews.text: Stayed at the Grand Hyatt for4 nights. On the 3rd night early morning of the 4th we had a fire alarm go off at 4.45 am which because of a malfunction was not able to be silenced until 8.30! We were told we would get a refund for the night but are still waiting for this !
reviews.title: Fab city

reviews.text: Other than that the room was ok - fab huge comfy bed, but was a bit disappointed with bathroom.Saying that we did not spend much time in room as NY is such a fab city.
reviews.title: Definitely not grand!
Nice hotel-Not so nice staff
reviews.text: No tea or coffee making facilities in room either which was rather disappointing also.
To say this is a 4* hotel it was a little disappointing. The reception and entrance area is far grander than the rest of the hotel.
reviews.title: great room, great location, great hotel
Ruined NY trip
reviews.text: We booked a "lexington suite" which we were told was more spacious than the basic double room. What we found was a very small bedroom, a postage stamp sized bathroom with no tub and no space to spread personal items out around the sink. The advertised square footage was made up by a nearly totally separate "study" which had a desk with no drawers, no paper or pen/pencil, and a very weak desk lamp. The wireless internet was an extra charge as is common at 4-star hotels, but it was not their own service but rather T-mobile, so one had to compete for bandwidth with the rest of the neighborhood, which meant basically dial up speed. No housekeeping service was received during our 2-night stay. The air conditioner blew directly onto the head of the bed. The lighting was poor all the way around. There was no mirror in the bedroom. Only one bathrobe was provided in a room booked for 2 people. When we checked out and tried to leave our bags with the bell desk, we were asked for a receipt, which we did not yet have -- I read that another Trip Advisor member had the same problem. Whe we retrieved our luggage, the bellman dropped my computer bag on the floor hard and did not apologize. They also didn't offer assistance getting our luggage downstairs to our limousine at the front door. In short, neither the room nor the service was four-star. This was our second stay at this hotel and we will definitely never stay there again.
My stay at the Grand Hyatt was great. The hotel rooms were modern, clean, and spacious by NYC standards. I was very pleased with my selection, with the exception of the noise.
reviews.title: Great hotel. Thin walls.
Another Wonderful Stay at the Hyatt
reviews.text: I was unfortunate enough to stay at the hotel during some sort of kids dance competition, which meant I was surrounded by obnoxious pageant moms and unruly kids. Despite the great room, I encounter challenges sleeping each night thanks to guests who did not realize other people were staying at the hotel. My sleep was continually interupted by guests in the hall talking at all hours, kids running up and down the halls, a conference call first thing in the morning in the room next door, and people yelling from room to room at one another.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I highly recommend this hotel as long as you feel you can sleep through anything.
reviews.title: Average hotel but in a good location

reviews.text: On another note, I would like to pass along a word of advice that the taxi driver from the airport shared. I flew into LGA, and the taxi driver told me to make sure I pay roughly the same price on the fare into the Hyatt as when I leave. He said many doormen and drivers have quite the scam going in the city for tourists. I definitely encountered this with the doorman I dealt with at the Hyatt. I specifically asked for a Yellow Taxi. He quickly shuffled me into the taxi who had been waiting in a 'no standing zone'. The driver explained my fare would be a flat rate of $37... $12 more than it should be. I aked him to explain, he said it is always a flat rate on the way to LGA, and that meters are not used. Do not be fooled this is completely inaccurate. I promptly hopped out, grabbed my luggage and moved on to a taxi that was driving by. I was told AGAIN this is one of the many scams taxi drivers and doormen pull on unsuspecting tourists. He also encouraged me to report the driver, as he can lose his lisence.
reviews.title: Doesn't live up to the reputation of the Hyatt chain...best location but not worth it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Needless to say my fare was $25.
reviews.title: Fantastic stay at the Hyatt!!!

reviews.text: Exquisite room and first class service. the staff are very hospitable and polite. love the market on the ground floor-very convenient. Excellent location to all the great tourist attractions. Highly recommended and will surely stay there next time.
reviews.title: amazing

reviews.text: Stayed for 3 nights a week before Christmas with my husband and two children. We booked a room that comes adjacent with a living and dining room. Very spacious for the four of us. Fabulous location and a really good hotel. Room was clean and recently refurbished. Check-in was smooth and quick. Doormen were always present and extremely helpful. We needed a big taxi to accommodate our luggages and they managed to locate one for us within minutes. The Grand Club staff were very friendly and accommodating. We walked from this hotel to Times Square, Macy's on 34th and to the Apple Store on 59th. All within 15 to 20 minutes walk from this hotel. We will certainly come back to stay here during our next visit to cool NYC!
reviews.title: Fabulous Location, a really good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very nice stay at the Grand Hyatt. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The first room we were assigned the bathroom smelled of cigarette smoke. The woman at the front desk changed our room. The second room had a leaky toilet, which the staff was able to fix so we did not need to change room again. We had a charge of 12.00 on the bill for phone calls. They charge for 1800 calls. The woman at the front desk removed the charges. We had a king room and I thought it was a decent size.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: Our last stay at the Grand Hyatt New York was 9 years ago, so we were familiar with the central location and proximity to Grand Central Station (which we like). This year, we stayed in two rooms on the newly renovated 24th floor from 12/15 - 12/19. I was very impressed with nearly every aspect of the Hotel and the renovated rooms. Upon check-in, we were greeted by the very pleasant and helpful Amanda who granted our request for two rooms next to each other, both with two double beds. The upgrade to the renovated floor was a nice surprise, and Amanda even gave our three girls their own Hyatt teddy bears. What a great welcome! As others have stated, the lobby is very large and beautiful. There is always a lot of activity there, and music booming in the bar area gives it the feel of a trendy NYC club. But the noise disappears when you step into the elevators--and there are a ton of elevators. We never waited more than 15 seconds for an elevator, and they move very quickly. Not even time to enjoy the television inside the elevator before arriving at our floor. The corridors and rooms on the 24th floor have a very chic, modern feel. The color scheme is sophisticated yet comforting. Rooms are very roomy by NYC standards. A few touches I enjoyed in the room included the iPod docking station/radio/alarm, flat-screen TV, the safe lighted from the inside with room for my laptop, the big "rainfall" shower head, chaise sofa, modern light fixtures and light switches, and nice size walk-in closet. Beds were plush, the room temperature always comfortable, and the bathroom amenities were upscale. Our window looked out over Grand Central Station, and we never heard any street noise. Hot water was plentiful--never an issue. Plenty of towels for the entire family. And no evidence of any bedbugs in either room after four nights. The tub was missing a stopper. We stuffed a wash cloth in the drain to hold water for baths. Housekeeping did a nice job cleaning the room but was inconsistent in leaving clean wash cloths and drinking glasses. And, as others have pointed out, a coffee maker would have been nice. My only other concern is the security of this hotel. There is nothing to prevent someone from coming in off the street and going up the elevators to the guest floors. I would recommend adding room card access to the elevators. Hotel personnel were usually standing by the elevator bank, but I never saw them question anyone. We had no problems, but I did see one person who didn't appear to be a guest go up and then quickly back down one day. I couldn't help but sense he was making some sort of delivery (hopefully a legal one). I could be wrong about him, but there is nothing to prevent this. The Grand Hyatt is a straight shot across 42nd street to Times Square--a 10-12 minute walk. Rockefeller Center and St. Patrick's Cathedral area is an easy 12-15 minute walk up Fifth Avenue. The New York Public Library and Bryant Park--where we love to ice skate, is a very short walk, and the Empire State Building is not far from there. Not to mention everything is easily accessible from Grand Central Station, where we also enjoyed cheesecake from Junior's every night. Tip: the iPhone GPS makes using the subway SUPER easy. It will tell you which train to get on and how many minutes until departure and arrival. Overall, I give the Grand Hyatt very high marks for location, comfort, and value. The staff was very friendly, though not intrusively so. My wife and I agree that we would stay at the Grand Hyatt again on our next visit to New York City.
reviews.title: Renovated Rooms are Truly Grand

reviews.text: We stayed a few nights in the Grand Hyatt with our friends in December. On arriving to the hotel our friends were given a double room and we got a king room. After taking our luggage to the room we went to see our friends' room - and were astonished. Their room was almost twice as big as ours, and they had a nice view to the city compared to our view, which was the opposite wall! We went immediately to the reception to ask for a double room, and were lucky enough to get one. Especially if you pay the full price (which isn't advisable, by the way - use Priceline instead), don't be satisfied with a king room, when you could get a much bigger one for the same amount of money. In addition, the king rooms don't have a bath, only a shower. Due to a high floor, our room didn't have any kind of problem with the noise from the streets. The downsides of staying in a high floor are the elevators. There aren't enough of them for a hotel this size. Almost every time we had to wait for one, and on the way down they kept just stopping and stopping until they were crammed. Besides, our room was facing the elevators, and the noise woke us several times during the night.
reviews.title: Book double!
Awesome
reviews.text: Was a little scared about booking this hotel after reading some of the reviews, but I went and did it anyway. Spent three nights there from September 8th - 11th. Got an awesome room - check out the pictures. I think I was soooo fortunate because I booked the room through the hotels website and I joined the rewards club too. Room had two huge beds, they were the most comfortable i've ever had. Through the webiste I was able to book a "quiet" room and they didn't disapoint. I would have to say this was probably the biggest room I have ever stayed in. I was also able to check in by phone on the morning of our arrival. This was a very friendly and helpful service. The operator did ask us if it was alright that our bathroom would only have a shower instead of the bath/shower, and since we both prefered those type this was no big deal.

reviews.title: Do not stay here!
reviews.text: The proximity to everything is awesome - with the Hyatt having its own entrance to Grand Central Terminal made getting around NY very easy. We ended up taking the subway to and from JFK which is kind of a scarey experience if you have never taken the subway before....just make sure to pack light. This Hotel is within walking distance to everything in the mid town area llike the Empire State Building, Central Park, Times Square. And then everything downtown you just take one airconditioned subway and everything is within walking distance down there too. It seemed that the subways that run North-South are a lot better than the ones that run East-West.

reviews.title: Great Hotel Location
reviews.text: I plan on staying here next time I visit New York

reviews.title: This is the 'best' location for any first time visitor!
reviews.text: I have been many times to New York and travelled extensively both in really expensive hotels and really cheap ones. But this is the least value for money i have ever had. 609 USD plus taxes for a room where the color in the ceiling of the bathroom is falling off, a bathtub dirty and rusty "hole". The wall paper was coming of the seam broken. Dark dungy carpets. Do not stay here. Lousy service at concierge desk unfriendly. The positive was a comfortable bed and central location close to everything. If you want to stay close to good restaurants and fun bars stay in Meatpacking District or Lower East or somewhere in SoHo, Tribecca. This is for tourist with too much money.

reviews.title: Good stay overall
reviews.text: Stayed two nights at the Grand Hyatt. Rooms were quite large by NYC standards, the beds were very comfortable, and my room was extremely clean (especially for NYC standards) Of course the lobby is impressive. What makes the clean room even better is the central location of the hotel and the ease of getting around the city. I actually enjoy taking the subway around the city and this hotel at Grand Central is very convenient for that. I would definitely stay at this hotel again and the priceline value was exceptional.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for three nights at the Grand Hyatt. LOVED the location, right on top of the subway, right next to Bryant Park, within walking distance of Broadway, Hell's Kitchen, great shopping and much more. Bed was wonderful; the most comfortable hotel bed I have slept in. Room size was OK for New York. Didn't qualify as a four star hotel in my mind, though. Bathroom had peeling wallpaper, cracked caulking, no fan, old fixtures, cracked washbasin, a lousy hairdryer (bring your own), and poor quality towels. No fridge/minibar or coffee maker in the room. I am sure other rooms in the hotel are both quieter and nicer, and got the impression (though have no proof) that we got a less desirable room since we had booked through Priceline. Food and coffee at the hotel was way too expensive, but Grand Central station is right there with lots of eateries, which is where we had breakfast one morning. Service was good with fast check-in, but the maid forgot to replace our washclothes each morning. One of the most impressive things was the elevator service: we waited only seconds each time we were going to or from our room on the 16th floor.
reviews.title: Some plusses, some minuses
Good hotel for the money
reviews.text: We stayed at the Grand Hyatt for 3 nights at a price of $110/night. Definitely worth the price. THe lobby is large and pretty. The rooms were OK, but honestly, we were hardly in them, being that we didn't even get back to our room until 3am-4am every night. The bathroom has to be the smallest space I have ever seen. The location was great, and I would stay there again if I could get another great rate.

My family went to NY for the first time and stayed here, it was a very comfortable hotel. Location was excellent , within walking distance of major tourist attractions. We would definitely stay at the Grand Hyatt again!!!
reviews.title: Excellent stay at The Grand Hyatt

likes.liked: — Everthing was like new and very clean.
likes.disliked: — The Sky Bar restaurant was closed after lunch.

reviews.text: Travelers tip: Do not book ground transportation through Golden Touch transportation.
reviews.title: Grand Hyatt was ok but not a great place to eat at all

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was my first trip to NYC and honestly, I don't see a better location. It is between Grand Central and the Chrysler Bldg. We took a shuttle bus from the Newark Airport that dropped us off a block away on 41st & Lexington (hotel is 42nd & Lexington). The subway is right there and from Grand Central you can go anywhere or grab a quick bite to eat.
reviews.title: Fabulous Location & Great Service

reviews.text: No trouble checking in. We arrived a few minutes before check-in but had no issues going straight to our room. We had used some points and were upgraded to a Club room on the 31st floor (and then given a lower rate!). The breakfast was nothing fancy but did get us started for the day. Being able to come back and relax for a few with a snack before heading back out for the evening was nice. Luzema the concierge was fantastic. The doormen were very helpful with getting a cab. There is a great little market downstairs to grab a bite and it wasn't too outrageously expensive. There are plenty of cafes around the hotel.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel - Great Location

reviews.text: The rooms are a bit on the small size (bigger than a European room but smaller than a typical American room). However it was more than adequate and this is New York where space is at a premium. Rooms were clean and appeared to be recently updated.
reviews.title: Great location but overall unimpressed with room or service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall this was a great hotel and great stay.
reviews.title: Great location and friendly staff.

reviews.text: Stayed here on a business trip in December. Booked with priceline and got a fairly good deal at $150 per night. Sometimes hotels give the priceline customers the smaller/poorer rooms but the Hyatt gave me a large suite which was very nice. Very clean room and comfortable bed linens. Didn't really use any of the other hotel facilities but as a place to sleep I can recommend it. Great location right over grand central.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: I arrived at an un-earthly hour of 07:00 after my flight from São Paulo arrived at Newark at 05:15. I asked if I could check in and leave my bags with Concierge and was told yes (Check-in is for 16:00 on the day and check-out is at 11:00), but we don't have your room ready but we have another free if you'd care for it. Thanks I said, and went up to the room to shower and change.
reviews.title: Centrally Placed Delight!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: How many hotels would be so kind as this? Effectively, I got an extra half day at the place for free!
reviews.title: No complimentary services

reviews.text: I was here to see New York and didn't want to stay in my room.
reviews.title: Location is worth $$$$$$$

reviews.text: The room was a very nice size, clean with all the creature comforts that I needed and was on the 25th floor, overlooking Lexington Avenue, in the shadow of The Chrysler Building.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: Grand Central Terminal was below, what more could I want to explore the city.
reviews.title: horrible experience
New York City Trip Grand Hyatt, right next to Grand Central Station
reviews.text: This hotel is pricey, but definately worth the price. I would definately stay there again. It was small, but clean and nice. Close to everything.

We have a rate here and I paid about $218 which is good value for this part of midtown. Room very well appointed and recently refurbished by the looks of it. Slept very well. The corridors and rest of the hotel could do with a bit of modernization, but on the whole no complaints.
reviews.title: Nice midtown hotel

reviews.text: This hotel is perfectly placed for exploring New York city, about a 20 minute walk to Times Square. Like most city hotels it is quite clinical and impersonal but all staff were friendly and helpful. Room was very clean with a great view. Noise was a problem, from within rather than outside the hotel, but you cannot blame the hotel for very noisy guests. I would definately recommend the Grand Hyatt as the perfect hotel from which to explore the amazing city of New York.
reviews.title: Fantastic location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a really super break at this hotel. Our room was well appointed and very quiet despite the hotel being very busy with conferences and a dance competition. We had asked for a quiet room at reception and we were not disappointed. The hotel is located in a central area with easy access to all major tourist attractions.
reviews.title: great location
Smelling smoke in a non smoking room...
reviews.text: Food in the hotel was very expensive but there are great delis and restaurants around, we had no trouble finding good meals close by.Though the weather was very cold we were able to see all the things we wanted. February is a good time to visit. We didn't have to queue to see anything.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned for this Hotel having spent 4 nights there. The Hotel is a really nice and the staff are polite and very helpful. We had a really large room and it was tastefully furnished, although the bathroom was tiny. We enquired about phoning home and the receptionist explained to us we could get a mobile phone from them and call anywhere in the world for just 39 cents a minute to a mobile or landline we did this and found it great. The hotel is right beside Grand Central Station so its ideally situated if your using the subway.
reviews.title: Very Central

reviews.text: The only fault I found with this Hotel is the fact that they charge 2$ per suitcase or bag if your leaving your bags there after checkout, it not much but considering the price of the rooms per night I think this should be free of charge.
reviews.title: Great Location, fair accomodation

reviews.text: We found a lovely Irish Bar called the Long Room, the barman Fintan was great and gave us loads of tips, ie. areas to see, how to get there, restaurants and bars to try and his help was really appreciated.
reviews.title: Grand Hyatt New York Shifted my loyality to the Hyatt Chain

reviews.text: First off, let me say that I would stay here again. The location and staff make up for this hotel's shortfalls. That said, you should know about the shortfalls... it's not 100% on the cleanliness side of things. There were hairs in the bathroom, and the second day we came home to find a dead fly on one of our pillows. Granted, it appeared to have died of natural causes, but it was still not something that makes you confident about their standards. The hotel was nice enough to give us a free breakfast voucher to compensate for the incident.
reviews.title: Safe Bet

reviews.text: The staff was extremely helpful with tips about the city, theatres, restaurants, and attractions. The location was ideal, right beside Grand Central; it was also an easy walk to Times Square. These points definitely helped to overshadow the cleaning issues.
reviews.title: Mrs.

reviews.text: When I arrived by cab at the rear entrance on the second floor, the bellman wasn't there. The valet person called the lobby twice for service but no one showed up. So I loaded up the baggage cart with my things and headed to the first floor to the front desk. When I was just a few feet from the desk, I was accousted by four bellman who were more concerned that I not take the cart to the front desk. I was so shocked by their rudeness and no one bothered to ask to assist me with my things. Instead of arguing, I took my bags off the cart and headed to the front desk. I immediately told the desk manager that so far, their hotel had failed my expectations for a 4 star hotel and that the staff was acting more like I would expect at a 2 star motel. The desk manager apologized but did nothing. I then checked in and waited for my companion to arrive. While waiting, I asked the desk manager to have my things taken to my room. As I handed over my items, the bellman had the nerve to wait for a tip when he was one of the men who snatched the cart from me. Of course I didn't tip the guy! Anyway, my guest finally arrived and we went to the room. The Room - Very small, hardly furnished, no mini fridge and with a terrible view and a very small window. We didn't even have a formal dresser to put our things! The Bathroom - Extremely small and you had to leave the door open in order to use the small 20" sink. It was very ackward because the sink faucet (though modern) was placed at the wrong angle so the small countertop got overly wet during every use. Anyway, the worst thing about the bathroom was the old towels. Although we didn't get many towels they were so overly used, stained a little and well below the 4-star quality. The sheets had little black stains too! After returning from dinner that night, I called housekeeping to obtain more towels and it took them over 90 mintues to complete the request despite additional calls. By the time they arrived, we were in bed. Anyway, the next morning at 6am, I went to the front entrance and saw no one so I hailed a cab. Before getting in the cab, I noticed a large fellow (the bellman) standing inside one of the hotel doors shooting the breeze with another man. I didn't think much of it until the next morning when he failed to acknowledge me or hail me a cab. So before I got in the cab I called the guy over (and read his name tag). I asked Pedro was it his job to hail cabs for guests and he said yes. While I closed the door in his face, I said he was doing a ---- poor job at it! All of this is true and unbias when I stayed at the Grand. So if you like thin walls (hearing sounds of sex on one side and a tv on the other side), a crappy view, small room and extra small bathroom with old towels, The Grand is for you! Not worth the $140/night I paid. More like 1-star for 49.99/night! Despite the great location, stay somewhere else!!
reviews.title: Not even a 4-Star Hotel

reviews.text: After reading some of these reviews, I was a bit nervous about staying here. All my worries disappeared once we walked into the lobby - it was beautiful. The hotel staff were super friendly. We were able to check in electronically and although there were no lines - it was most convenient. We were able to check in at 11AM and our room was clean and cool. The bathroom itself was small but clean. The vanity area was huge and well lit. The room-service menu prices were absolutely ridiculous but who needs room service in NYC?! Just walk outside to find just about any type of food you could want. The hotel's location is convenient to everything and you can catch the subway next door at Grand Central. Very very nice place. Be sure to check out Pomme Frites in Greenwich Village for the best french fries ever.
reviews.title: Really nice place

reviews.text: A friend recommended the Grand Hyatt for my family’s summer vacation to NYC. After shopping online for the best rate, I actually found the best price calling the Grand Hyatt direct and made the reservations months in advance. As the time approached for our vacation, I continued to monitor “Trip Advisor.” Several of the reviews caused me to question our decision, after reading of others’ bad experiences. We stayed with our choice and are we glad that we did!
reviews.title: I shall return!
Loved it!!!
reviews.text: The lobby is impressive and my kids were immediately impressed with the TV in the elevators. Our room was larger than expected and very clean. The bed and linens were very comfortable. Although our time in the room was limited, it was very enjoyable and restful. I appreciated the obvious and not so obvious security that I observed. Once entering the lobby after 6pm, guests were asked to show room keys, prior to entering the elevators. The woman before me was offended and felt inconvenienced by this. I did not and was thankful for the screening.

I found that the staff was very accommodating. I needed to print an airport shuttle confirmation for my group of five. I used the business center, finding the staff very friendly and willing to assist. Although there are additional charges posted for the internet access, etc., I was excused of any fees with a great smile and a “have a great day” send-off. On our last night, I conferred with the Concierge on a pizza delivery suggestion. The recommendation was made immediately with menu in hand! In 30 minutes time, my family was in agreement; it was the best pizza that we’ve had in a very long time!
reviews.title: Excellent location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Travelled to NYC with my wife for 2 nights after purchasing hotel on priceline. Check in staff were quick and pleasant. Our room was on the 16th floor and had a view down 42nd St. The room was a good size for New York and had a queen size bed. There was a walk in closet to store your clothes and bags, a large LCD TV, a small but functional bathroom with decent water pressure.
reviews.title: Highly recommended

reviews.text: Internet was reasonable at $10 per day and worked well. The room was clean and nicely decorated. Loved the fact that hotel is next to Grand Central Station. There are some terrific economical restaurants in there and we chose not to spend our money on room service. The gym is open 24 hrs and the treadmills have personal TV's to watch while working out.
reviews.title: Good but not Grand

reviews.text: We loved the location, a quick 10 minute walk to Times Square...access to subways nezt door....lots of meal choices within a few blocks.
reviews.title: It's ok, not the 4 Star it's built up to be

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wouldn't hesitate to return here
reviews.title: Cheap with bad quality

reviews.text: Recently stayed at the Grand Hyatt for 4 nights on business to NYC. Got a great rate on Priceline. The hotel's location CAN NOT be beat. It is on top of Grand Central and from there you can get virtually anywhere you need to go. The rooms are adequate but housekeeping is hit or miss. Some days they never emptied the trash nor changed the dirty glasses. All in all, I would stay there again if the price was right but to pay rack rate is not worth it. Best part of the hotel is the workout room. One thing to beware of are taxis through the hotel. I needed a taxi to the airport and the hotel had one that was standing by. The driver refused to put the meter on and when I asked how he planned on knowing what to charge me for the ride, he quoted an astronomical flat rate. This is an illegal scam and I was very disappointed to see it happening in the city I grew up in. A taxi from Manhattan to LaGuardia airport is based on the meter reading and anthing otherwise is a blatant attempt to rip off unsuspecting tourists.
reviews.title: Great location!

reviews.text: I stayed here for a girls weekend with a couple of my best friends. The room was clean, modern and even had a great view of Grand Central Station. The room itself was small. Which you would expect from a NYC hotel. We spent most of our time enjoying the city. The one drawback of this hotel are the overpriced drinks at the bar. The bar and lobby are very modern and stylish but not worthy of 20$ mojitos.
reviews.title: Very modern, stylish hotel in a great location.
Met all my needs
reviews.text: I picked this hotel because it is on top of Grand Central. I had a bunch of meetings over two days in New York, so I took MetroNorth in, dropped off my bag with the bellman and took subways and buses everywhere. For someone from CT, the location is really excellent. I was pleasantly surprised by the size and quality of the room. It was huge and very clean. All amenities were great. I liked the advance online check-in service and my room was ready early. Separate charge for wifi (approx. $12/day). would definitely return. (PS, I did not get the vouchers others mentioned.)

reviews.title: Great deal, great location!
reviews.text: Was very impressed with my stay at the Grand Hyatt. It has been renovated and has a sleek, modern decor. It is a great location right next to Grand Central Station, and plenty of sights, shops, and restaurants around. We got a great deal here, and I would definitely stay here again. The beds were super comfortable after long days of shopping!

reviews.title: Will book again
reviews.text: I'm not sure why this hotel is so far down the trip advisor list in NYC. It's the best hotel I've stayed at (I found it better than Waldorf towers but everyone's tastes are different) in the city. Rooms are very large for New York standards, beds extremely comfortable, rooms well decorated and well equipped. Location is excellent. I have already booked this hotel for my next visit.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having read reviews before my trip, I was prepared, and at registration asked if I could make three requests: a high floor, a room far from the elevators, and to be on Park Avenue rather than 42nd Street. The very friendly young man at the desk was able to honor all three requests, the third only because I had reserved a room with two double beds. He even offered a late checkout for the day we were leaving, at no extra charge. He also gave me six vouchers good for coffee, tea, or water, at the little food shop in the lobby. I'm not sure if everyone gets those, or if they are for Hyatt credit card customers. Our room was spacious, and immaculately clean. The beds were incredibly comfortable, and there was a chaise, a well-padded desk chair, plenty of space in drawers and in the closet, and also a refrigerator large enough for two full size bottles, and several smaller items. We had a great view, but were not bothered at all by noise from traffic, as we were so high up. We never did take the train, but enjoyed exploring Grand Central Station, and walked to Times Square, a nearby restaurant, and a Broadway show, taking cabs for restaurants which were farther away. Every staff member we dealt with or met was friendly and helpful, and the lobby has an exceptionally generous number of chairs, sofas, and padded benches, so when we had one last hour to spend before heading for our bus, we had a comfortable place to take turns minding our bags, as each of us took one last trip to a nearby store or point of interest. I would love to return to this hotel!!
reviews.title: Maximum satisfaction, highest recommendation!

reviews.text: My husband and I booked a room in the Grand Hyatt in March of this year. We were going to stay 3 nights. Upon arrival the room wasn't ready. We were told to explore the city and they held our bags for us. The lobby was very nice with water falls. After spending some time shopping we returned and our room was ready. As we were being taken to our room I noticed that the hallway had a terrible stench. I thought it may be food but I could smell it through out the hallway as we were walking to the room. The room was very, very disappointing. First of all, it was extremely small, even by NY standards. The room was smelly. Maybe it was because it was smoked in, but it was strong enough to make me ill. I've never experienced a smell like this and I travel a lot. I wasn't going to be able to sleep with that smell. In addition, the carpet, furniture and curtains were worn. The window ledge inside the room was dirty. It looked like it wasn't cleaned for quite some time. We went down to the lobby to let them know that we were leaving. They didn't even have an apology for us-----very poor customer service. They did, however, offer to move us to another room. We were afraid the condition would be the same so we left. We had to pay a nights stay anyway. (This hotel is very OVER-priced!) We went back to stay at the Sheraton New York Hotel and Towers to stay. We stayed at that hotel back in 2003 and had a wonderful experience so we knew it would be a safe bet and it was! Do not stay at the Grand Hyatt New York. You will be very disappointed ! I highly recommend the Sheraton New York Hotel and Towers instead.... it is a very clean and classy hotel, great customer service too!
reviews.title: So terrible we left!!!!
Overpriced no matter what you pay
reviews.text: Booked this hotel through a conference. $649/night plus NY and NYC taxes means more than $700/night. No internet service, so I called the front desk and was directed to the business center. Stand in line there, but then told that the front desk handles all wireless problems and go stand in line again at the front desk to to get the TMobile hot spot device to plug into my computer. $250 billed to my room; refunded when I return device. Back in my room, I spend 15 minutes getting signed in for $10/24 hours and do some email. 2 hours later, service is off and demanding another $10, so I have to spend another 15 minutes on the phone with the hotel and TMobile to get reconnected. Was in and out of first room several times from afternoon to evening and realized that I was sneezing and getting a headache whenever in the room. Finally looked up in the bathroom and realized that the top of the bathroom door frame and part of the bathroom ceiling was covered -- and I mean covered -- in heavy black mold. Call the desk. Would I like to move? Well, duh, yes. They send up a bellman to hand me a key to a new room. Move myself upstairs and find that I am now in a room with a broken lightswitch, two burned out lightbulbs in desk and table lamps, and an especially attractive cigarette burn on the toilet seat.

This level of "service" and amenities was insulting. Next time I have to stay mid-town, I'll just stay at the Affinia. About the same level of service and amenities, but at least they're candid about it and it's about $450/night cheaper.
reviews.title: A Grand Hotel.
"Grand" Lobby...tiny unimpressive room
reviews.text: After a really dreadful flight with Virgin Atlantic (an over rated airline) the comforts of this hotel were most welcome. This was our honeymoon, so we were praying our stay went well, and it did. The room was fantastic, the maid service was super. The staff are a credit to the hotel, always friendly and warm. A spotless and clean hotel, situated in an ideal location. If you are looking for a trouble free place to stay, then you will not go far wrong at the Grand Hyatt. We spent 7 nights and would return again. But NOT with Virgin Atlantic, the return flight back to the UK was WORSE than the outward leg. Delayed flight, rushed service on board, rude ignorant stuck up cabin crew. If at all possible choose BA or a US airline.
Stayed here for business two nights. Location is perfect. Lobby is beautiful. BUT...
reviews.title: Recommend the Grandy Hyatt

reviews.text: This is a perfectly fine hotel in a very convenient location. Some of the negative reviews here seem to be from people who somehow expect a huge business/convention-oriented Hyatt to be a five-star establishment with a high level of personal service. If that's important to you, then you need to find a nice upscale boutique elsewhere, but if you just want a clean, comfortable reasonably sized hotel room with the usual amenities (though admittedly no in-room coffee) this will do just fine. While this is not my favorite NY neighborhood, the transit connections just next door at Grand Central Station make it easy to get just about anywhere in Manhattan and beyond via subway -- you'll save on cab fares. Check-in and check-out were quick and painless. Can't comment on the fitness facilities or restaurants as I didn't try them. However, if you don't like the hotel restaurant offerings, there is no shortage of breakfast and lunch places in the neighborhood, though I might venture a little further afield for dinner. The area is bustling because of its proximity to Grand Central, but I heard no street noise at all from my 20th floor room. Again, you have to understand what sort of hotel this is, but if you're OK with that I would recommend it.
reviews.title: A Good Hotel -- But It Is What It Is

reviews.text: GREAT LOCATION! Tacky lobby, crappy rooms, digusting bathrooms........ far too expensive. Out of date.......... however.....GREAT LOCATION!
reviews.title: Out of date.......

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hyatt should have a total makeover to come up to todays standard.
reviews.title: Great Hotel With Excellent Location

likes.liked: — Location, Decor, Comfortable Bed, Lobby, Doormen

reviews.text: Just back from our stay in New York at the Grand Hyatt. As like a lot of reviewers I began to wonder if this place would be a mistake, but was very relieved to find it to be a great place to stay.
reviews.title: Fantastic!!!!

reviews.text: The lobby is magnificent with a beautiful granite waterfall greeting you upon entering the hotel. Very upscale and perfectly decorated.
reviews.title: Excellent service, excellent location, great hotel

likes.liked: — Room decor, location of hotel, friendly and helpful service
likes.disliked: — Bathroom coulld have been cleaned better, but I am very particular...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are looking to quickly drag your bag from Grand Central and be at your hotel, this is your spot. The hotel has a huge lobby. Check-in was reasonably swift. It's a large hotel, but we never had to wait long for an elevator.
reviews.title: Couldn't get closer to Grand Central

reviews.text: The room was clean and quite spacious for a NYC hotel. It even has a small couch and table. This hotel is not for those seeking a boutique experience. You are just a number, but that's not to say the service wasn't good.
reviews.title: Great location in Manhattan

reviews.text: There's a gym, food on-site, and you are very close to all midtown attractions.
reviews.title: Grand Hyatt always delivers!

reviews.text: Stayed here with the family on several occasions and I must admit that the location of this establishment is simply fabulous. Walking distance to Broadway, next door to Grand Central Station and to the Apple Store... to name but those. Service can be somewhat impersonal but they do see lots of people on any given day. Breakfast is expensive and good but one can find a much better deal at the friendly diner across the street or at some spots inside Grand Central Station. Rooms have been well renovated and although they are not very large, they certainly are very comfortable. We will definitely be back since we believe the high price is well worth the fantastic location.
reviews.title: Grand Hyatt New York..., nothing Grand about it!!!

reviews.text: Fabulous stay at the Grand Hyatt. Great room on the club floor, excellent customer service and experience. This is my go to / first choice hotel for any visit to NYC. The lounge was enjoyable and the Concierge service knowledgeable and helpful. This hotel delivers on all fronts and is great when travelling solo or in company.
reviews.title: Great hotel for 3day shopping trip

reviews.text: Overall my stay was fine. The beds are very comfortable and the hotel is so convenient to a lot of sights i.e. Broadway, Times Square, etc. and of course the subway is right there. There are some nice shops right in Grand Central.
reviews.title: Everything is Relative

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can't comment on the restaurants since I didn't eat at them but I heard they were extremely over priced and to avoid them, which I did.
reviews.title: Great hotel! Small rooms
The Hyatt was Grand!
reviews.text: My only complaint is that the bathroom and the room itself were small with not much walking space, but I guess that is average for NYC.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall I had a nice stay and I would probably stay there again.
reviews.title: The Hyatt was great!

reviews.text: I've been to N.Y. a few times and this time I got two free nights at a Hyatt of my choice through my Credit Card. The hotel is located at Grand Central Station and we walked right by the lobby because it's not very descript. The Front Desk employees were very pleasant and made us feel welcome. For a NY room, it was huge. The best thing about this location is the subway system is at your doorstep, therefore you can walk or take the subway to most attractions. Although I was disappointed that every bar/restaurant nearby was nothing but tourists So you won't get the real NY experience. I took my 17yr old nephew for his 1st trip to NY, so I guess it suited our needs since it was a sight seeing trip. I would definitely recommend this Hotel if this is your first trip to NY and want to see the sights.
reviews.title: Tourist Hotel

reviews.text: We took advantage of weekend rates on Saturday through Monday which made the stay a good value. And we really enjoyed this stay. The Hyatt creates a nice experience. It is centrally located. Our room was clean and for the most part, this was a great place to "launch" from for our NYC trip.
reviews.title: Solid experience with family trip

reviews.text: The choice of this hotel lies more with traveler preferences. It is not intimate - though staff is very friendly. The rooms are small -especially for family travel. But that is true virtually everywhere in NYC.
reviews.title: Grand Hyatt is truly grand

reviews.text: A suggestion for family or tourist travelers - make sure that you preplan your restaurant choices and your travel options around the City. You don't want to waste a lot of time trying to figure out how to get from point A to point B in the City. If you are doing quite a bit on the West side the 7 line takes you across and otherwise it isn't a long walk for those who are healthy .If you value healthy eating especially take the time to locate those types of restaurants and markets. We discovered the Whole Foods up at Columbus Circle. And that worked great.
reviews.title: Great location, efficient staff, impersonal vibe.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They did have a little bit of a problem finding our reservation made through Priceline - so not too sure what the breakdown was there - but we easily got through it because we had everything printed out.
reviews.title: Location, location, location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can not put in words the way I was made to feel as soon as I checked in. But here goes . After flying for almost 24 hours and arriving at the hotel without my luggage thanks to the airlines, and my wife in tears. The check in staff could tell my wife and I were upset and immediately not only give us a beautiful upgraded room but also sent us a bottle of wine and chocolate covered strawberries. I will only from now only stay at this hotel when ever I come back to New York City. Thank You Grand Hyatt
reviews.title: THE BEST HOTEL I EVER STAYED AT IN NYC
Best located hotel we stayed at
reviews.text: We got a great deal via Priceline and got to stay at this hotel for two nights. Like the first NY hotel we won before, the room was one of the smaller ones facing another hotel. We noticed a small stain on one of the sheets. We kindly asked for another sheet and the manager apologized and offered an upgrade. The next night we got the most amazing suite with a huge room and living room. The best part about staying in huge hotels like this is they have the resources to make sure you have the best experience during your stay. They also store your luggage for a small fee, so if this happens to be the last leg of your trip, it's still a perfect location to store your bags, go about town, and come back to pick it up before heading off to your next destination.

This is the worst hotel that I have ever stayed on this planet, staff are very rude and only interested in how they can get an extra dollar from guests ,from the time you arrive till you leave.Bell boys are rude and obnixious and need training in hospalitility service, send them to Dubai to learn this, and rest of staff also so that they understand thier gusts aspirations! room service is terribleand have to make repeated requests to meet our requests.Rooms are dirty and bathroom is so small that , flusing the loo wakes up half the neighbourhood and can hear what is going on in other rooms due to dated decor and paper thin walls.They even charge for looking after your luggage 12 dollars for 3 bags.?
reviews.title: rudest hotel in world

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This Hotel was nice with a great big lobby and large hotel room, but the bed was small as we requested a King and got a Double. Not enough room for two people. In a room that size a queen could have fit perfectly and maybe even a King if need be. Other than that it was good. Why use a double bed in a single room any way.
reviews.title: Big Room, Small Bed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great hotel, massive. Information desk for tickets, restaurant was a great help. Only downside was promised king size and gave double. Large room, small bed.
reviews.title: Excellent Location, Lobby and Clean Room
'Grand' Hyatt is very misleading
reviews.text: This is the first time I have stayed at a Hyatt, and it will certainly be my last. The location is central, but pedestrian traffic to/from Grand Central make the sidewalks outside the hotel very busy. It is a short walk from the NYAS Coach stop for services to LGA and JFK as well, which is convenient if you are trying to avoid using taxis.

reviews.title: DO NOT stay here!!
reviews.text: The hotel is expensive however, paying over $250 a night for what is an appalling hotel. I wouldn't want to stay in a regular Hyatt if their upscale property, Grand Hyatt, is anything to go by. The room, whilst relatively large, was poorly designed and did not use space efficiently, which resulted in an absolutely tiny bathroom. As some other reviewers have stated, you could barely move in there. Although there were two windows, due to the room looking over a courtyard/alley, there was very little natural light in the room, and the old, dull decor further assisted in making the room very dingy. The staff didn't respond to our numerous requests for maintenance assistance either.

reviews.title: Don't Stay here!
reviews.text: It is also a very loud hotel. We were woken up numerous times on several nights at 2/3am when groups of people returned to their rooms shouting loudly in the hall ways.

reviews.title: Excellent hotel
reviews.text: But the creme de la creme has to be the $2 per bag charge when leaving your baggage with the (rude) concierge after checkout for a few hours - having just spent $1500 on your room bill, this is disgusting.

reviews.title: huge rip-off
reviews.text: With all the hotels in New York, there are plenty which are far superior to the Grand Hyatt New York, in fact, probably most New York Hotels. Don't waste your money here.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got married on dec 28th 2010 and departed heathrow early on morning of 29th december to embark on our journey to NYC. Due to all the recent crazy snowfall we were so happy to be going as we really did doubt it! after a great flight with virgin atlantic we arrived at jfk, customs took about 30mins so that was good. The 20 minute trip from JFK to midtown Manhattan took 3 hours because the roads were so bad in Queens, NYC state, which we had to drive through to get to Manhattan. On arrival to our hotel we were greeted with a luxurious, well kept, enormous lobby. the decor was beautiful, huge vases of flowers everywhere and a cascading waterfall at the front rotating doors. The colour everywhere is gold. We were welcomed quickly by a friendly female receptionist, we told her we were on our honeymoon and she upgraded our room free of charge to a larger newly refurbished room on the 24th floor. The hotel is undergoing renovation at the moment and Virgin let us know this about 6 months ago, but during our whole week there we did not see one work man or hear any noise at all, you would never know it was there. The main hotel restaurant was closed for refurbishing and there was a temporary one there instead, to be honest i didnt even notice as it was done so nicely. We did not have breakfast in the hotel as we chose to eat out but there is a very convienient 24hour store called Market in the lobby which sells wine, beer, soft drinks, hot meals, breakfast, chocolate, crisps, cookies, icecream whatever you want and it didnt cost any more than the news agent in Grand cenral terminal nexct door Hudson News. Rooms gorgeous modern and new, nice shower and bathroom, king size bed awesome heaven to sleep in. large LG tv in room with about 50 channels, nice desk and walled in closet. Lifts were fast and well kept. Overall I would 100% go back to this hotel or any other Hyatt hotel.The hotel is sandwiched between grand central terminal and the chrysler building, it takes 10mins to walk to Times Square, 5 mins to walk to New York Public Library, 10 mins to Empire State. The subway is quick and easy to use and is good when going downtown to ground zero, statue of liberty and to the brooklyn bridge. Grand central terminal is awesome for food and breakfast in particular. There is a large cafe opposite the hotel called Pershing Square breakfast here is awesome, quite expensive but worth it. Overall NYC is expensive at this time due to the economic climate but it is still more reasonable than UK, as you get a lot more for your money. Going off the beaten track is defo the way for cheaper meals. PIzza by the slice in NYC is awesome, better than Italy dare I say it!! Ate once in TGI Fridays as we left it till 10.30pm to eat as decided to go to Rockafeller center top of the rockl after the xmas show at Radio City, it was probably the most expensive meal we had as chains in the USA are as overpriced as they are in the UK but my NY steak was awesome, cooked perfectly.
reviews.title: AMAZING I WOULD GO BACK RIGHT NOW

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you want to see a Broadway show be prepared to wait a few days before you will get in and be prepared to pay a lot. We saw Wicked which was amazing, tickets cost us $114 each which is about £80 each so quite similar to west end prices, maybe even a little more. Those seats were the orchestra seats so thats good.
reviews.title: Great location, great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall go to NYC and stay here you will have the time of your life.
reviews.title: Very Disappointed. $400 a night for a NOISY ROOM!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hyatt from 16th - 21st Dec 2010 and were extremely happy with the hotel. We'd stayed with a Hyatt before in Maui so having had a good experience last time, and seeing a competitive price, we went for it this time.
reviews.title: Great experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon arrival, we checked in instantaneously and were told that because we were staying for a while, they would upgrade us for free, from a Double to what I'm guessing was a Deluxe King - a huge bed, very spacious, sofa, desk, etc. And to top it off, right outside our window was the Chrysler building - couldn't have asked for better. As with the other Hyatt we stayed in, the room was nicely decorated, helpfully had some iPod speakers next to the bed and was generally very comfortable. And after a long day of sightseeing / shopping, it was just perfect to return to it. The only noise we heard, apart from the traffic which wasn't a problem, was a noisy neighbour. Down at reception, some renovation work was underway but disruption was kept to a minimum and it didn't distract from the attractive lobby, filled with Xmas trees.
reviews.title: Dissapointing to the max......
Don't waste your $$$$$!!!!
reviews.text: My mother in-law booked this hotel through her travel agent for our honeymoon. When we got there the hotel looked more like a shopping mall. It was packed w/ people checking in and out. The carpet in the lobby was dirty and out dated. I could barely open the door to our room because it was so heavy and the handle was a piece of crap. The bathroom was dirty. There was urine dried up on the floor around the toilet. The bathtub was the smallest one I've ever seen. There was no mirror in the room besides, behind the door in the closet. Not good for putting on make-up. The room was tiny and they didn't have anything you would expect in a hotel room such as a coffee pot or mini fridge. Room service was over priced!!!! And you had to pay for every outgoing phone call whether it was local or an 800 #. My mother in law said she paid $400.00 a night for this room for five nights, you would think these little things would be included. The walls are paper thin. I could here the woman in the next room having conversations on the phone and she left her TV on all night. I could here every word! I didn't sleep well. I could here the vaccume running in the room above us in the mornings. And of course being on our honeymoon we would have liked some privacy. We couldn't enjoy ourselves because we felt like everyone could here us.

reviews.title: Grand Hyatt was Great
reviews.text: I read the negative reviews on here and just ignored them. I didn't think the Hyatt could be that bad, but it was. I don't recomend staying there.

reviews.title: Try It, You'll Like It!
reviews.text: My family and I stayed in the Grand Hyatt for 5 nights in October 06 to celebrate my 40th birthday. I wanted to stay somewhere special and this hotel lived up to my expectations. The hotel is located between Grand Central station and the Chrysler Building. The lobby is beautiful - very spacious and special. Our room was on the 25th floor overlooking the Chrysler - although I had to lie on the window sil to see the top of it! We had two double beds which was fine for a family of four. The room was very clean and the bathroom was small yet functional - nice toileteries!!

reviews.title: Complete rip-off
reviews.text: The hotel is a ten minute walk to Times Square and about 15mins to the Empire State Building. We visited the ES firtst thing on our first morning - we arrived at 7.45 as it opened at 8 and were at the start of the queue. It was excellent!!

reviews.title: Nice hotel for the money
reviews.text: Our first two days were taken up doing the uptown and downtown bus loops (red sightseeing buses) which I would highly recommend. We went to the theatre and saw Tarzan with tickets booked through the hotel theatre ticket booth. Breakfast in the hotel was expensive so we opted for the cafe Metro over the road (next door to Mc Donalds) which was excellent. There is a coffee bar in the lobby that opens at 6 a.m.

Best thing is the location. Next to Grand Central Terminal for catching the subway, a Duane & Read drugstore at the 42nd St. intersection (for bottled water, etc.), Starbucks around the corner on Lexington Ave. for a cheap, quick breakfast. Midtown location means $25 fare from LGA Airport; you can also cab it for a relatively cheap fare whether going Uptown or to Theatre District.
reviews.title: Good enough for price/quality
Location was great
reviews.text: Arrived at 9am and we were allowed to check in so this was much appreciated. Room with a king bed is good size. Room with 2 doubles is smaller but okay. The bed is the best thing about the room. The firm mattresses, down comforter and bed linen are truly wonderful. Bathroom is small - the basics are there but there are no extra towels, no luxury toiletries. The a/c unit makes a terrible racket all night long - like a gurgling, babbling brook - but at least the cool air was comfortable. Poor lighting in the bedroom so forget about reading your guidebook at night. No coffemaker or teas, but you do get a free newspaper every morning. There is no privacy as you can hear everything outside, which means people can hear you inside your room...

reviews.title: I Have Stayed at nicer Holiday Inns
reviews.text: Service at front desk ranges from friendly to indifferent, depending on who serves you. No better, no worse than other hotels.
The Sky Bar was never open. Didn't eat here so can't judge the restaurants.
reviews.title: An oasis
The place to stay in NYC
reviews.text: Some people have mentioned Pershing Cafe for breakfast. Yes, it has ambiance and great decor but for better value, go to Jane's Deli at 43rd St. (corner 2nd Ave.) where a hot breakfast costs less than $4. It's also cheaper to pick up drinks and fruit here than at the Grand Central Market but beware, Jane's is open only Mon-Fri.

I am an experienced traveller, for both business and pleasure – both international and domestic. I have stayed at the “Grand” Hyatt properties in Asia. If you think you will be coming close here in New York, think again!
reviews.title: Not so grand Hyatt
Superb all around
reviews.text: This is a very tired property that is living off the location (the ONLY good point) and the name. The rooms are small and dreary with tiny windows located along long sprawling corridors that reminded us of a rundown mega-hotel in Las Vegas. This property has over 1300 rooms, so if you are expecting any semblance of personal service forget it… in fact if you are expecting the operator to answer the phone you are probably pushing it. There are no fridges in the rooms, and room services prices make a dinner on the town look reasonable. (Glass of OJ $8.00, Eggs and Bacon $22.00).
The bottom line is simply this. If you have another option in New York take it. If you don’t then set your expectations accordingly.
reviews.title: Good Location

reviews.text: Stayed three nights at the end of May 2006. Reserved a king room, on-line a month in advance and checked in early to find just what we requested.
