The room was very large - apparently a deluxe room,. Small bathroom with tub and toilet and sink/vanity outside. Perfectly clean and fine. Large desk with lamp, a reading chair with ottoman, two windows, a large almost walk-in closet with a mirror inside the door and an ironing board. We ordered a roll away bed which fit nicely in a corner of the room and didn't disrupt the traffic flow at all.
reviews.title: Hyatt at its Best

reviews.text: Service was excellent all around. Management very responsive. Friendly staff. Friendly concierge who arranged a last minute birthday celebration in the Commodore lounge and cake on-the-house.
reviews.title: Great Experience

reviews.text: I loved the decor of this hotel, both the public spaces and my room. My room was well laid out with easy access to outlets and lights through out the room. The decor is very modern but very welcoming and warm. The service was great. The food/beverages/incidental shop in the lobby is very accommodating. The bar was fun and the service excellent. I was giving a speech at a conference and the only problem was the hotel forgot the group's lunch so there was a scramble.
reviews.title: Really Great Trendy Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Grand Hyatt is absolute first class, my husband and I stayed here for 4 nights and found the hotel location, facilities and service to be great.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are modern, clean and the beds are very comfortable. The hotel is centrally located you can head out to Lexington Ave to catch the subway and a cab can easily be caught out front.
reviews.title: Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Highly recommended to anyone willing to pay a little extra for a little more
reviews.title: Good hotel in good location

reviews.text: For being convenient it can't be beat. A shuttle from JFK drops across the street from Grand Central and the Hyatt main door is almost next to a Grand Central entrance. The hotel lobby is busy and huge but the check-in procedure was very expert, fast and friendly. The elevators are designated for lower or upper floors and always seemed to be available. Our room on a high floor was comfortable though for some reason there was only an empty cupboard space where perhaps a refrigerator was supposed to be. Kind of strange but we didn't miss it and didn't ask about it. There was a snack shop in the lobby for cold drinks or ice cream, etc.
reviews.title: waist your money elsewhere

reviews.text: This was my first stay at the GH in New York, and I was only there for 24 hours. However, these are my impressions. The hotel itself is very large, and as such, does not provide the "personal" style you get from smaller places (or other hyatts I have stayed at).
reviews.title: Decent, but nothing special

reviews.text: I booked a deluxe king room and had a best room on the day guarantee (through platinum status). The room was very plain and faced out onto another part of the hyatt (no view at all). If that is one of the better deluxe rooms, then I do not think much of their room ratings. I may be a bit harsh, but I have assessed their rooms against other hyatts and 4.5/5 star hotels
reviews.title: Perfect location when arriving in city by ground transportation.

reviews.text: The gym is great, and I did not use room service. The front desk staff were very polite and helpful, but I could not believe that they charge a departing guest $2 per bag to hold your bags for you (maybe this is common in NYC, but I have never come across it elsewhere) - it's not the money that upset me, it was the principle.
reviews.title: Great stay, with only a few issues.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of the hotel was fantastic, making it an easy walk to Times Square and also being right on top of grand central station, so getting around on the train was very easy.
reviews.title: Fantastic location, very good hotel

reviews.text: When arriving at Grand Central it was great to be able to enter the hotel without having to leave the station on such a cold night. The service was excellent and room quiet considering it's location. The only negative is the bathroom toiletries...the scent is more like porta potty than the herbal fragrance they boast.
reviews.title: Excellent Site for Business Meetings, Guest Room Walls are PAPER Thin!
Great Location and Fair Room
reviews.text: I stayed at the Grand Hyatt the weekend of July 21. It is in a great location since you are next to Grand Central. However, I have been to NYC a few times but if you are going for your first visit I would recommend staying somewhere near the Times Square area.

reviews.title: Are you kidding me?
reviews.text: The rooms were average nothing special. But I do not go to NYC to sit in the room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For the priceline rate I paid it was fine. I would try somewhere else next time but it was Ok.
reviews.title: What is everyone complaining about?
Not what I expected!
reviews.text: Booked our stay thru Priceline, so had no choice on hotels. Just wanted to be sure we got at least a four star, to make sure our trip was enjoyable and as problem free as possible. The price was ok, I've seen higher and lower prices for the same hotel, so no complaint’s there. What I can complain about was the cleanliness of our rooms and the noise. The room itself was sized well enough but the bathroom was not. It is way too small. I’m 5’7” /140lbs and found it a bit annoying to move around. There is little to no space to put your bathroom essentials and there’s a considerable amount of mold and mildew in the shower and on the ceiling above the door. Apparently the housekeeping staff isn’t trained in correctly cleaning bathrooms which is evident by the abundance of dried urine around the toilet. Come on now people, everyone should know how to clean a bathroom, especially if you’re getting paid to do it! No ventilation fan, so you might want to shower with the door open, but that leaves you with a host of other problems doesn’t it. The Grand Hyatt creates the illusion of a larger room by doing away with furniture. The window ledge acts as a table for the ice bucket and glasses. Feel free to call and request a mini-fridge at $25.00 a night, if your phone works which ours didn’t, along with several light bulbs, oh the list could go on and on…Let’s review:
•Extremely small bathroom
reviews.title: Nice Hotel - But Very Busy and Crowded

description: Premier location in the heart of New York's famous midtown. Striking lobby with waterfalls, seating areas and three restaurants and lounges. Direct access to Grand Central Terminal and connected to the Chrysler Building. Steps from Times Square, Shopping and the Theatre District.
